page.title: 13E.W.KING, SEED MERCHANTS
page.content: E.W.King owns 310 acres of land on the Coggeshall road.The company started in 1923,and now grows runner beans,peas, lupins,lettuce,corn,etc.They have a problem with rabbits,pigeons,(which eat the seeds)and insects.Fences are put up to keep out rabbits and scarecrows fend off birds.Mr.Phillips said that only 5% of King's seeds are English.Monk's Fm.is apparently a small farm compared with ones in California and other foreign places.16 people work for Mr.Phillips.Monk's Farm used to be owned by the Westerns of Felix Hall.Then in 1914 E.W.King bought the land.He died in 1930. Mr.Phillips has 7 tractors ,and 3 combines.20 yrs.ago,there were 18 men,and 10 women on the farm. They sell their seeds to companies like Suttons and Hursts.
